Action.author: jjjjibm
Action.body: A little internet search shows that Win32 126 can mean 'Module could not be found' which makes sense in this context. Should SDK surface the error as is?

Action.author: jimthematrix
Action.body: not going to support windows 7 so let's try to get a test on windows 10 and see what happens.

Action.author: jjjjibm
Action.body: Please link to Gerrit patch before closing. Thanks.

Action.author: jimthematrix
Action.body: after discussing with ~ChristopherFerris we'll address this as a unique problem for contributors or app developers windows support

Action.author: jjjjibm
Action.body: Date: Tue May 23 17:10:06 2017 -0400 FAB-3253 Should attempt to load bccsp_pkcs11 Windows platforms (Win7, Win10) throw a different error message for this case. The solution is to test process.platform for 'Win32' and use the Windows error as the expected error. Change-Id: I66e86a3e5284ee267ebd24c0a6b47514155979a9 Signed-off-by: jjjjibm The fix was easy once I had node-SDK running natively on Win7 and Win10. >
